cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating N-NE then NE toward the Florida Big Bend and across North Florida into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key / Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Gulf coast of Florida from Indian Pass to Englewood
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through northeast Florida, Georgia and the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Monday night into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the northeast Florida coast and St. Johns River during onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated higher amounts up to 8 inches possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday afternoon and evening across northern Florida
